trans-unit.source: Driver Model Settings Properties for Driver Projects
trans-unit.target: Driver Model Settings Properties for Driver Projects

trans-unit.source: Sets the basic properties for a kernel-mode or user-mode driver, including the WDF library version and preprocessor definitions.
trans-unit.target: Sets the basic properties for a kernel-mode or user-mode driver, including the WDF library version and preprocessor definitions.

trans-unit.source: Setting driver model properties for driver projects
trans-unit.target: Setting driver model properties for driver projects

trans-unit.source: Open the property pages for your driver project.
trans-unit.target: Open the property pages for your driver project.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the driver project in **Solution Explorer** and select **Properties**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the driver project in **Solution Explorer** and select **Properties**.

trans-unit.source: In the property pages for the driver project, click **Configuration Properties** and then click **Driver Model Settings**.
trans-unit.target: In the property pages for the driver project, click **Configuration Properties** and then click **Driver Model Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Set the properties for the project.
trans-unit.target: Set the properties for the project.

trans-unit.source: Type of driver
trans-unit.target: Type of driver

trans-unit.source: The type of driver when the driver **Configuration type** is **Driver**.
trans-unit.target: The type of driver when the driver **Configuration type** is **Driver**.

trans-unit.source: Note that this option is available only when projects use the **WindowsKernelModeDriver8.0** toolset.
trans-unit.target: Note that this option is available only when projects use the **WindowsKernelModeDriver8.0** toolset.

trans-unit.source: Possible values are:
trans-unit.target: Possible values are:

trans-unit.source: **WDM** (including all miniport/port drivers such as NDIS or StorPort).
trans-unit.target: **WDM** (including all miniport/port drivers such as NDIS or StorPort).

trans-unit.source: **KDMF** A KMDF driver.
trans-unit.target: **KDMF** A KMDF driver.

trans-unit.source: **Export driver (WDM)** A WDM driver that exports functions which other drivers can call.
trans-unit.target: **Export driver (WDM)** A WDM driver that exports functions which other drivers can call.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Creating Export Drivers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff542891).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Creating Export Drivers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff542891).

trans-unit.source: KMDF Version Major
trans-unit.target: KMDF Version Major

trans-unit.source: When the type of driver is KMDF, this option specifies the major version of KMDF that will be used when compiling your driver.
trans-unit.target: When the type of driver is KMDF, this option specifies the major version of KMDF that will be used when compiling your driver.

trans-unit.source: The KMDF\_VERSION\_MAJOR entry informs the MSBuild utility that it must link the driver to the KMDF library.
trans-unit.target: The KMDF\_VERSION\_MAJOR entry informs the MSBuild utility that it must link the driver to the KMDF library.

trans-unit.source: You can build a KMDF driver for an earlier minor version of the library.
trans-unit.target: You can build a KMDF driver for an earlier minor version of the library.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could build a driver using KMDF Version Major=1 and KDMDF Version Minor=9 (KMDF Version 1.9) rather than 1.11 so that the driver could be shipped in a package containing an earlier version of the WDF co-installers.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could build a driver using KMDF Version Major=1 and KDMDF Version Minor=9 (KMDF Version 1.9) rather than 1.11 so that the driver could be shipped in a package containing an earlier version of the WDF co-installers.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Framework Library Versioning](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff542842).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Framework Library Versioning](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff542842).

trans-unit.source: KMDF Version Minor
trans-unit.target: KMDF Version Minor

trans-unit.source: When the type of driver is KMDF, this option specifies the minor version of KMDF that will be used when compiling your driver.
trans-unit.target: When the type of driver is KMDF, this option specifies the minor version of KMDF that will be used when compiling your driver.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Framework Library Versioning](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff542842) (11, 9, 7, 5).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Framework Library Versioning](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff542842) (11, 9, 7, 5).

trans-unit.source: If you omit the KMDF Version Minor, the most recent minor version is used.
trans-unit.target: If you omit the KMDF Version Minor, the most recent minor version is used.

trans-unit.source: UMDF Version Major
trans-unit.target: UMDF Version Major

trans-unit.source: When you have a UMDF driver, this option specifies the major version of UMDF that will be used when compiling your driver.
trans-unit.target: When you have a UMDF driver, this option specifies the major version of UMDF that will be used when compiling your driver.

trans-unit.source: See [UMDF Version History](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff561356).
trans-unit.target: See [UMDF Version History](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff561356).

trans-unit.source: When you have a UMDF driver, the **Configuration type** is **Dynamic Library (.dll)**.
trans-unit.target: When you have a UMDF driver, the **Configuration type** is **Dynamic Library (.dll)**.

trans-unit.source: UMDF Version Minor
trans-unit.target: UMDF Version Minor

trans-unit.source: When you have a UMDF driver, this option specifies the minor version of UMDF that will be used when compiling your driver (11, 9, 7, 5).
trans-unit.target: When you have a UMDF driver, this option specifies the minor version of UMDF that will be used when compiling your driver (11, 9, 7, 5).

trans-unit.source: If you omit the UMDF Version Minor, the most recent minor version is used.
trans-unit.target: If you omit the UMDF Version Minor, the most recent minor version is used.

trans-unit.source: Allow Date, Time, and Timestamp
trans-unit.target: Allow Date, Time, and Timestamp

trans-unit.source: Defines the standard C/CPP macros for \_\_DATE\_\_, \_\_TIME\_\_, \_\_TIMESTAMP\_\_.
trans-unit.target: Defines the standard C/CPP macros for \_\_DATE\_\_, \_\_TIME\_\_, \_\_TIMESTAMP\_\_.

trans-unit.source: Override Target Configuration Preprocessor Definitions
trans-unit.target: Override Target Configuration Preprocessor Definitions

trans-unit.source: Overrides the default values for preprocessing symbols: \_WIN32\_WINNT, WINVER, WINNT, and NTDDI\_VERSION for your source file.
trans-unit.target: Overrides the default values for preprocessing symbols: \_WIN32\_WINNT, WINVER, WINNT, and NTDDI\_VERSION for your source file.

trans-unit.source: Note that the default values are controlled by the current target configuration.
trans-unit.target: Note that the default values are controlled by the current target configuration.

trans-unit.source: Related topics
trans-unit.target: Related topics

trans-unit.target: Framework Library Versioning

trans-unit.target: Building and Loading a Framework-based Driver

trans-unit.target: UMDF Version History

trans-unit.target: Building UMDF Drivers
